Greatsword Kensai

There is something special about Sword Saints, big two handed wielders wearing robes, lightning fast movement, tremendous defensive powers.

I borrow ideas from Valerfor's excellent build, The Iron Fist, Monk 35 for outrageous spell resistance and Fighter 4 pre-epic for BAB 26 and pre-epic play-ability.

With the remaining level I had a few options.
SpoilerOne rogue or assassin level for UMD Another fighter level for EWS. Another monk level for +1 SR
UMD seemed the most powerful (ie wands of LSB, scrolls of premonition/greater spell mantle/summon IX, equipment flexibility).
I chose rogue for the extra skill points and not needing to be evil. 
Assassin avoids exp penalties and can use poison.
HiPS sounded great too. I think with +110 monk speed crowd control is covered.

Some stats at a glance:
Base AB 40, Strength 30
446 HP, F30 W24 R22 +2 mind +1 death
254 skill points
20% exp penalty from level 31 onwards
Spell resistance 55
+110 movement speed
+8 Tumble AC, +7 Monk AC, +1-7 Monk Wis AC

Combat feats: 
Blind Fight, Expertise, Improved Knockdown, Improved Disarm, WF/EWF/IC: Greatsword, EP

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I like your thinking here, Orion, and this is definitely a build I could play.

You'll probably have seen these already - a couple of Valerfor's builds - but they're worth a look. I know they don't have the same classes as you take, both being Monk/ Fighter/ WMs. (I've played the Whirlwind up to level 40 in both dev crit and non-dev crit environments, and she's a delight. Valerfor himself says Lightning Strike is the more optimized build, but I've yet to try it out.) Obviously, neither have the massive SR, nor UMD, but the AB shines a little brighter.

Just including for compare and contrast purposes, as the purpose of your build is slightly different.

Whirlwind of Steel (M25/F8/WM7)
Lightning Strike (M20/F4/WM16)

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I like it, Orion, & in this case, I would definitely go for the Dev Crit version.

Sure, the AB might be a tad low but the benefit of going through hordes of tough-as-nails wizards with impunity cannot easily be understood unless you leave this first-person. Having 90% of these drow arch-mages just staring at you is a satisfaction that can only be compared with a healthy dose of peanut-butter spread over a loaf of bread in the morning, or similar pleasures, anyway. 

And the AB is alright anyway, 40 +6 (strength) +5 (weapon) +2 (aid+bless pot) = 53AB.
With all that speedy Gonzales maneuverability you can also employ hit-and-run tactics, alpha-strikes, corner alpha-strikes, etc. with ease.
It's in tough magic environments where this build shines the most & it's a blessing for traversing the huge maps of WoG likewise.
